intro: Crepis fastigiata, commonly known as the upright thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with a dense, upright growth habit. Its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in late summer to early autumn. Crepis fastigiata is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
